oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sylvester McBee poses in front of his Vine Avenue fruit stand
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Business Districts
African American business enterprises; African American men
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Man wearing a bowler hat, bow tie, white shirt and suspenders, and white apron, standing at the open door of a fruit and vegetable stand, with bushel baskets displaying all manner of produce.

Not only did McBee's store on Vine Avenue, in the heart of the Knoxville's African American business district, offer fresh produce, notices painted on the store window panes advertise "sliced melon on ice" and "ice cream" and customers were furthered enticed by placards promoting cigars, soft drinks, and candy bars.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Beck Cultural Exchange Center, Knoxville, Tennessee
